front.title: Requirements for Extending BGP/MPLS VPNs to End-Systems

abstract.t: Service Providers commonly use BGP/MPLS VPNs [RFC 4364] as the control plane for wide-area virtual networks. This technology has proven to scale to a large number of VPNs and attachment points, and it is well suited to provide VPN service to end-systems. Virtualized environment imposes additional requirements to MPLS/BGP VPN technology when applied to end-system networking, which are defined in this document.
